title: go.tools/cover: confusion with the mode option in help
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?

1. go test -coverprofile=c.out -covermode=atomic
2. go tool cover -html=c.out -mode=atomic

What is the expected output?

Open my web browser with an awesome "heat map!"

What do you see instead?

Usage of 'go tool cover':
Given a coverage profile produced by 'go test -coverprofile=c.out', open
a web browser displaying annotated source code:
...


Which operating system are you using?
Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')

go version devel +f4d1cb8d9a91 Thu Sep 19 22:34:33 2013 +1000 darwin/amd64

Please provide any additional information below.

I just got confused, thinking that mode needed match the covermode, having only read the
examples at the top and the flags at the bottom. To save the next guy some time, maybe
something like this:

  -mode="": coverage mode when generating source: set, count, atomic
